revised_title: Observations of the Solar Eclipse of May 1, 1706
tldr: The author, John Flamsted, describes his observations of the solar eclipse on May 1, 1706, from the Royal Observatory at Greenwich. He notes the weather conditions, the equipment used, and the times of the eclipse. He also mentions Captain Stannyan's observation of a red streak of light preceding the sun's emergence, which suggests the moon has an atmosphere.
